result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Michael Bui was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody Michael Bui is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody Michael Bui was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Cody Michael Bui was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine - Presence of Child Less Than 14 Years Old

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation on 08/17/22 by 04:00PM
- 3 days credit against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

1:41 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Cody Michael Bui in court, Attorney T. Gregory Amann in court for Cody Michael Bui. INCLUDES 22CF46 and 22CF119. ADA Becker recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 4 - Battery and Ct 6 - Criminal Damage to Property. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 4 - Battery and Ct 6 - Criminal Damage to Property. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 1-3 and 5 in 22CF46 and 22CF119 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. 

Court orders: 
22CF46
Ct 4 - Battery
S/W 18 months probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- No contact with Alex B.
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Ct 6 - Criminal Damage to Property
S/W 18 months probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- No contact with Alex B.
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

3 days jail credit.
Apply bond on file; payment plan approved to continue for balance.
Defendant to report to probation no later than 4:00 PM today.

Adjourned: 1:57 PM. kma
Phone Number and Employer Update; filed by DE.  gll
Pretrial Bond Report. SEALED. Filed by JSC. km             to kap

AMENDED 
$500 on file

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Alexander S. Baillargeon or his residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in the presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:03 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today  DF:  Cody Michael Bui appeared from jail by video means. Atty Harrelson states Defendant does not qualify for PD- PFAC given. Court advises of charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. Bond argument.
